item.title: Sunday data/statistics link roundup (5/20)
item.description: It’s grant season around here so I’ll be brief: I love this article in the WSJ about the crisis at JP Morgan. The key point it highlights is that looking only at the high-level analysis and summaries can be misleading, you have to look at the raw data to see the potential problems. As data become more complex, I think its critical we stay in touch with the raw data, regardless of discipline.

item.title: I don't think it means what ESPN thinks it means
item.description: Given ESPN’s recent headline difficulties it seems like they might want a headline editor or something…
